Class Fractal

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, SoundPlayer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FractalJulia, FractalMandelbrot
    public abstract class Fractal
extends DrawingSurface
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Abstract class to support plotting portions of fractals.

    Here is a link to the Source Code.

    Author:
    readda

        private static final double AUTO_ZOOM_FACTOR

      • plotOld

        protected void plotOld​(int row,
                       int col,
                       int magnitude)
        Plot a point on the display Color blending based on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17544157/generate-n-colors-between-two- colors
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the point
        col - The column of the point
        magnitude - The magnitude (e.g. iteration count) reached for this point

      • shiftImage

        private void shiftImage​(double percVert,
                        double percHoriz)
        Shift the image vertically and/or horizontally.
        Parameters:
        percVert - The percentage of shift vertically. Positive values shift up, negative shift down
        percHoriz - The percentage of shift horizontally. Positive values shift right, negative shift left

      • handleMouseClick

        public void handleMouseClick​(boolean left,
                             int x,
                             int y)
        Description copied from class: DrawingSurface
        This is a callback method that will be called if a mouse button is pressed. The parameters indicate whether it was the left mouse button (versus right) as well as the X and Y locations on the drawing surface where the mouse click occurred. Subclasses should override this method in order to process mouse clicks.
        Overrides:
        handleMouseClick in class DrawingSurface
        Parameters:
        left - True if it was the left mouse button that was pressed
        x - The X coordinate on the drawing surface of the click
        y - The Y coordinate on the drawing surface of the click

        public abstract void plot()
        Plot the fractal

      • saveCurrentImage

        private void saveCurrentImage()
        Save the currently displayed image to a file. The user will be prompted for the file name.

        private void saveCurrentImage​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Save the currently displayed image to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name, with optional path, of the file to write

      • handleMenuClick

        public void handleMenuClick​(java.lang.String menuItemName)
        Description copied from class: DrawingSurface
        This is a callback method that will be called if a MenuBar or JMenuBar item is selected. The parameter to the method is the text of the menu item (label) that was chosen.

        Subclasses should override this method in order to process menu item interactions by the user.

        Overrides:
        handleMenuClick in class DrawingSurface
        Parameters:
        menuItemName - The chosen menu item's text label
        See Also:
        MainFrame.setMenuBar(java.awt.MenuBar), MainFrame.setJMenuBar(javax.swing.JMenuBar)

      • handleKeyCode

        public void handleKeyCode​(int keyCode)
        Description copied from class: DrawingSurface
        This is a callback method that will be called if a keyboard key is pressed. The parameter will be the key code for the pressed key. Subclasses should override this method (or override handleKeyChar) in order to process keyboard input.
        Overrides:
        handleKeyCode in class DrawingSurface
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the pressed key
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, DrawingSurface.handleKeyChar(char)
